name.text: Interactive: Frequency table for the time taken and a Histogram

questiontext.text:
(a) Here is a frequency table for the time taken for students at a school to travel to school in the morning.
Fill in the column for the frequency density of each range.


Range \([min]\) Frequency Frequency Density
\(0 < t \leq {@first(second(data))@}\) {@third(first(data))*first(first(widthList))@} [[input:ans1]]
\({@first(second(data))@} < t \leq {@first(third(data))@}\) {@third(second(data))*first(second(widthList))@} [[input:ans2]]
\({@first(third(data))@} < t \leq {@first(fourth(data))@}\) {@third(third(data))*first(third(widthList))@} [[input:ans3]]
\({@first(fourth(data))@} < t \leq {@first(fifth(data))@}\) {@third(fourth(data))*first(fourth(widthList))@} [[input:ans4]]
\({@first(fifth(data))@} < t \leq {@first(sixth(data))@}\) {@third(fifth(data))*first(fifth(widthList))@} [[input:ans5]]
\({@first(sixth(data))@} < t \leq 60\) {@third(sixth(data))*(60-first(sixth(data)))@} [[input:ans6]]

[[validation:ans1]] [[validation:ans2]] [[validation:ans3]] [[validation:ans4]] [[validation:ans5]] [[validation:ans6]]

[[feedback:prt1]]


(b) By dragging the red points, complete the histogram below for the time taken for students to travel to school in the morning.


[[jsxgraph width="750px" height="450px" input-ref-ans7="sR1" input-ref-ans8="sR2" input-ref-ans9="sR3" input-ref-ans10="sR4" input-ref-ans11="sR5" input-ref-ans12="sR6"]] // [min, max] var ranges = [ [0, {#second(first(data))#}], [{#first(second(data))#}, {#second(second(data))#}], [{#first(third(data))#}, {#second(third(data))#}], [{#first(fourth(data))#}, {#second(fourth(data))#}], [{#first(fifth(data))#}, {#second(fifth(data))#}], [{#first(sixth(data))#}, 60], ]; JXG.Options.text.useMathJax=true; var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard(divid, { boundingBox:[-5,15,65,-3], showCopyright:false, showNavigation:false, keepAspectRatio:false, grid:true }); // Defining axes var yAxis = board.create("axis", [[0,0], [0,50]], { highlight:false, name:"\\(fd\\)", withLabel:true, label:{ fixed:true, highlight:false, fontSize:15, position:"rt", offset:[-20,-20], anchorX:"right", useMathJax:true, parse:false }, ticks:{ label:{ highlight:false, anchorX:"right", offset:[-10,0] } } }); var xAxis = board.create("axis", [[0,0], [40,0]], { highlight:false, name:"\\(t \\ [min]\\)", withLabel:true, label:{ fixed:true, highlight:false, fontSize:15, position:"rt", offset:[0,-40], anchorX:"right", useMathJax:true, parse:false }, ticks:{ label:{ highlight:false, anchorX:"middle", offset:[0,-15] } } }); var i; // Vertical segments along which gliding points can move var segList = []; for (i in ranges) { segList.push(board.create("segment", [ [(ranges[i][0]+ranges[i][1])/2, 0], [(ranges[i][0]+ranges[i][1])/2, 14] ], { fixed:true, visible:false })); }; // User movable gliders var pointList = []; for (i in ranges) { pointList.push(board.create("glider", [(ranges[i][0]+ranges[i][1])/2, 0, segList[i]], { showInfoBox:false, size:4, snapToGrid:true, withLabel:false })); }; // Constructing rectangels from glider points var constStyle = { fixed:true, visible:false }; var lineListHori = []; for (i in ranges) { lineListHori.push(board.create("parallel", [ pointList[i], xAxis ], constStyle)); }; var lineListVert = [ board.create("parallel", [ [ranges[0][0], 0], yAxis ], constStyle) ]; for (i in ranges) { lineListVert.push(board.create("parallel", [ [ranges[i][1], 0], yAxis ], constStyle)); }; var interList = []; for (i = 0; i < pointList.length; i++) { interList.push([ board.create("intersection", [ lineListHori[i], lineListVert[i] ], constStyle), board.create("intersection", [ lineListHori[i], lineListVert[i+1] ], constStyle) ]); }; for (i = 0; i < pointList.length; i++) { board.create("polygon", [ [ranges[i][0], 0], [ranges[i][1], 0], interList[i][1], interList[i][0] ], { fixed:true, highlight:false, vertices:{ fixed:true, visible:false }, borders:{ fixed:true, highlight:false } }) }; // Helper function to clamp input values function clamp(value, min, max) { return Math.max(min, Math.min(max, value)); } stack_jxg.bind_point(sR1, pointList[0]); stack_jxg.bind_point(sR2, pointList[1]); stack_jxg.bind_point(sR3, pointList[2]); stack_jxg.bind_point(sR4, pointList[3]); stack_jxg.bind_point(sR5, pointList[4]); stack_jxg.bind_point(sR6, pointList[5]); board.unsuspendUpdate(); [[/jsxgraph]]

[[input:ans7]] [[input:ans8]] [[input:ans9]] [[input:ans10]] [[input:ans11]] [[input:ans12]]

[[validation:ans7]] [[validation:ans8]] [[validation:ans9]] [[validation:ans10]] [[validation:ans11]] [[validation:ans12]]


[[feedback:prt2]]


(c) Estimate the number of students whose journey to school takes less than 20 minutes.

[[input:ans13]] [[validation:ans13]]

[[feedback:prt3]]

generalfeedback.text:
Worked Solution


(a)

Using the relationship: \( \displaystyle \mathsf{frequency \ density} = \frac{\mathsf{frequency}}{\mathsf{range \ width}}\)

The frequency density of each range can be found as the frequency divided by the width of the range:


Range \([min]\) Frequency Frequency Density
\(0 < t \leq {@first(second(data))@}\) {@third(first(data))*first(first(widthList))@} \(\frac{{@third(first(data))*first(first(widthList))@}}{{@first(second(data))@}} = {@tans1@}\)
\({@first(second(data))@} < t \leq {@first(third(data))@}\) {@third(second(data))*first(second(widthList))@} \(\frac{{@third(second(data))*first(second(widthList))@}}{{@first(third(data))-first(second(data))@}} = {@tans2@}\)
\({@first(third(data))@} < t \leq {@first(fourth(data))@}\) {@third(third(data))*first(third(widthList))@} \(\frac{{@third(third(data))*first(third(widthList))@}}{{@first(fourth(data))-first(third(data))@}} = {@tans3@}\)
\({@first(fourth(data))@} < t \leq {@first(fifth(data))@}\) {@third(fourth(data))*first(fourth(widthList))@} \(\frac{{@third(fourth(data))*first(fourth(widthList))@}}{{@first(fifth(data))-first(fourth(data))@}} = {@tans4@}\)
\({@first(fifth(data))@} < t \leq {@first(sixth(data))@}\) {@third(fifth(data))*first(fifth(widthList))@} \(\frac{{@third(fifth(data))*first(fifth(widthList))@}}{{@first(sixth(data))-first(fifth(data))@}} = {@tans5@}\)
\({@first(sixth(data))@} < t \leq 60\) {@third(sixth(data))*(60-first(sixth(data)))@} \(\frac{{@third(sixth(data))*(60-first(sixth(data)))@}}{{@60-first(sixth(data))@}} = {@tans6@}\)



(b) Here is the complete histogram shown below for the time taken for students to travel to school in the morning.


[[jsxgraph width="750px" height="450px" input-ref-ans7="sR1" input-ref-ans8="sR2" input-ref-ans9="sR3" input-ref-ans10="sR4" input-ref-ans11="sR5" input-ref-ans12="sR6"]] // [min, max] var ranges = [ [0, {#second(first(data))#}], [{#first(second(data))#}, {#second(second(data))#}], [{#first(third(data))#}, {#second(third(data))#}], [{#first(fourth(data))#}, {#second(fourth(data))#}], [{#first(fifth(data))#}, {#second(fifth(data))#}], [{#first(sixth(data))#}, 60], ]; JXG.Options.text.useMathJax=true; var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard(divid, { boundingBox:[-5,15,65,-3], showCopyright:false, showNavigation:false, keepAspectRatio:false, grid:true }); // Defining axes var yAxis = board.create("axis", [[0,0], [0,50]], { highlight:false, name:"\\(fd\\)", withLabel:true, label:{ fixed:true, // Set fixed to true highlight:false, fontSize:15, position:"rt", offset:[-20,-20], anchorX:"right", useMathJax:true, parse:false }, ticks:{ label:{ highlight:false, anchorX:"right", offset:[-10,0] } } }); var xAxis = board.create("axis", [[0,0], [40,0]], { highlight:false, name:"\\(t \\ [min]\\)", withLabel:true, label:{ fixed:true, // Set fixed to true highlight:false, fontSize:15, position:"rt", offset:[0,-40], anchorX:"right", useMathJax:true, parse:false }, ticks:{ label:{ highlight:false, anchorX:"middle", offset:[0,-15] } } }); var i; // Vertical segments along which gliding points can move var segList = []; for (i in ranges) { segList.push(board.create("segment", [ [(ranges[i][0]+ranges[i][1])/2, 0], [(ranges[i][0]+ranges[i][1])/2, 14] ], { fixed:true, // Set fixed to true visible:false })); }; // User movable gliders var pointList = []; for (i in ranges) { pointList.push(board.create("glider", [(ranges[i][0]+ranges[i][1])/2, 0, segList[i]], { showInfoBox:false, size:4, snapToGrid:true, withLabel:false })); }; // Constructing rectangles from glider points var constStyle = { fixed:true, // Set fixed to true visible:false }; var lineListHori = []; for (i in ranges) { lineListHori.push(board.create("parallel", [ pointList[i], xAxis ], constStyle)); }; var lineListVert = [ board.create("parallel", [ [ranges[0][0], 0], yAxis ], constStyle) ]; for (i in ranges) { lineListVert.push(board.create("parallel", [ [ranges[i][1], 0], yAxis ], constStyle)); }; var interList = []; for (i = 0; i < pointList.length; i++) { interList.push([ board.create("intersection", [ lineListHori[i], lineListVert[i] ], constStyle), board.create("intersection", [ lineListHori[i], lineListVert[i+1] ], constStyle) ]); }; for (i = 0; i < pointList.length; i++) { board.create("polygon", [ [ranges[i][0], 0], [ranges[i][1], 0], interList[i][1], interList[i][0] ], { fixed:true, // Set fixed to true highlight:false, vertices:{ fixed:true, // Set fixed to true visible:false }, borders:{ fixed:true, // Set fixed to true highlight:false } }) }; stack_jxg.bind_point(sR1, pointList[0]); stack_jxg.bind_point(sR2, pointList[1]); stack_jxg.bind_point(sR3, pointList[2]); stack_jxg.bind_point(sR4, pointList[3]); stack_jxg.bind_point(sR5, pointList[4]); stack_jxg.bind_point(sR6, pointList[5]); board.unsuspendUpdate(); [[/jsxgraph]]

(c) To find the number of students whose journeys are less than 20 minutes long, you need to find the frequency of the range \(0 < t \leq 20\).
This can be split up into whole ranges in the table from (a), and the range \({@if first(sixth(data))<20 then first(sixth(data)) else if first(fifth(data))<20 then first(fifth(data)) else if first(fourth(data))<20 then first(fourth(data)) else if first(third(data))<20 then first(third(data)) else if first(second(data))<20 then first(second(data)) else if first(first(data))<20 then first(first(data))@} < t \leq 20\).

For the range \({@if first(sixth(data))<20 then first(sixth(data)) else if first(fifth(data))<20 then first(fifth(data)) else if first(fourth(data))<20 then first(fourth(data)) else if first(third(data))<20 then first(third(data)) else if first(second(data))<20 then first(second(data)) else if first(first(data))<20 then first(first(data))@} < t \leq 20\), the frequency of calls can be estimated by calculating the area of the box in the histogram bounded by this range.
Using this, the number of calls in this range is \({@if first(sixth(data))<20 then 20-first(sixth(data)) else if first(fifth(data))<20 then 20-first(fifth(data)) else if first(fourth(data))<20 then 20-first(fourth(data)) else if first(third(data))<20 then 20-first(third(data)) else if first(second(data))<20 then 20-first(second(data)) else if first(first(data))<20 then 20-first(first(data))@} \times {@if first(sixth(data))<20 then third(sixth(data)) else if first(fifth(data))<20 then third(fifth(data)) else if first(fourth(data))<20 then third(fourth(data)) else if first(third(data))<20 then third(third(data)) else if first(second(data))<20 then third(second(data)) else if first(first(data))<20 then third(first(data))@} = {@if first(sixth(data))<20 then (20-first(sixth(data)))*third(sixth(data)) else if first(fifth(data))<20 then (20-first(fifth(data)))*third(fifth(data)) else if first(fourth(data))<20 then (20-first(fourth(data)))*third(fourth(data)) else if first(third(data))<20 then (20-first(third(data)))*third(third(data)) else if first(second(data))<20 then (20-first(second(data)))*third(second(data)) else if first(first(data))<20 then (20-first(first(data)))*third(first(data))@}\).

Therefore, the total number of calls in the range \(0 < t \leq 20\) is: \({@if first(sixth(data))<20 then sconcat(first(first(widthList))*tans1, "+", first(second(widthList))*tans2, "+", first(third(widthList))*tans3, "+", first(fourth(widthList))*tans4, "+", first(fifth(widthList))*tans5 , "+", (20-first(sixth(data)))*third(sixth(data))) else if first(fifth(data))<20 then sconcat(first(first(widthList))*tans1, "+", first(second(widthList))*tans2, "+", first(third(widthList))*tans3, "+", first(fourth(widthList))*tans4, "+", (20-first(fifth(data)))*third(fifth(data))) else if first(fourth(data))<20 then sconcat(first(first(widthList))*tans1, "+", first(second(widthList))*tans2, "+", first(third(widthList))*tans3, "+", (20-first(fourth(data)))*third(fourth(data))) else if first(third(data))<20 then sconcat(first(first(widthList))*tans1, "+", first(second(widthList))*tans2, "+", (20-first(third(data)))*third(third(data))) else if first(second(data))<20 then sconcat(first(first(widthList))*tans1, "+", (20-first(second(data)))*third(second(data))) else if first(first(data))<20 then (20-first(sixth(data)))*third(sixth(data))@} = {@tans13@}\).

questionnote.text:
{@data@}

\(0 < t \leq {@first(second(data))@}\)

\({@first(second(data))@} < t \leq {@first(third(data))@}\)

\({@first(third(data))@} < t \leq {@first(fourth(data))@}\)

\({@first(fourth(data))@} < t \leq {@first(fifth(data))@}\)

\({@first(fifth(data))@} < t \leq {@first(sixth(data))@}\)

\({@first(sixth(data))@} < t \leq 60\)

questiondescription.text:
Joseph BAYA

Given a frequency table for the time taken for students at a school to travel to school in the morning.The student is required to complete histogram shown below for the time taken for students to travel to school in the morning.

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

node.description: Checks for correct answer
Checks for correct answer
Checks for all included students

truefeedback.text:
You have included all of the students in the \({@if first(sixth(data))<20 then first(sixth(data)) else if first(fifth(data))<20 then first(fifth(data)) else if first(fourth(data))<20 then first(fourth(data)) else if first(third(data))<20 then first(third(data)) else if first(second(data))<20 then first(second(data)) else if first(first(data))<20 then 0@} < t \leq {@if first(sixth(data))<20 then 60 else if first(fifth(data))<20 then second(fifth(data)) else if first(fourth(data))<20 then second(fourth(data)) else if first(third(data))<20 then second(third(data)) else if first(second(data))<20 then second(second(data)) else if first(first(data))<20 then second(first(data))@}\) range.
However, some of the students' journeys in this range are longer than 20 minutes.

node.description: Checks for not all included students

truefeedback.text:
You have not included any of the students in the \({@if first(sixth(data))<20 then first(sixth(data)) else if first(fifth(data))<20 then first(fifth(data)) else if first(fourth(data))<20 then first(fourth(data)) else if first(third(data))<20 then first(third(data)) else if first(second(data))<20 then first(second(data)) else if first(first(data))<20 then 0@} < t \leq {@if first(sixth(data))<20 then 60 else if first(fifth(data))<20 then second(fifth(data)) else if first(fourth(data))<20 then second(fourth(data)) else if first(third(data))<20 then second(third(data)) else if first(second(data))<20 then second(second(data)) else if first(first(data))<20 then second(first(data))@}\) range.
However, some of the students' journeys in this range are shorter than 20 minutes.
